# High Performance Computing

The material for this week will be provided in a lecture given by the [Holland Computing Center](https://hcc.unl.edu/hcc).


## Module Objectives  {- #module14-objectives}

-  Use HPC resources on campus to execute code for  problems that are not suited to individual PCs

## Resources  {- .learn-more}

Here, I'm going to list off a few of the useful resources at the Holland Computing Center.

- [An introduction to High Performance Computing](https://hcc.unl.edu/docs/intro/)
- [Creating an account](https://hcc.unl.edu/docs/accounts/)
- [Connecting to the HCC clusters](https://hcc.unl.edu/docs/connecting/)
- [Basic Linux Commands (and a video tutorial)](https://hcc.unl.edu/docs/connecting/basic_linux_commands/)
- [Using X11 Forwarding (how to get minimal graphical application support via SSH)](https://hcc.unl.edu/docs/connecting/how_to_setup_x11_forwarding/)
- [Using R software on the cluster](https://hcc.unl.edu/docs/applications/user_software/r_packages/)
